title: Warriors’ Stephen Curry to miss Thursday’s game against the Celtics
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Stephen Curry will not play against the Celtics on Thursday due to ongoing knee pain and swelling.
Curry has missed 16 games this season, and the Warriors are 6-10 without him.
Golden State acquired Krastaps Porzingis recently; he will debut against the Celtics on Thursday.

title: Local obituary: Bob Aliano, worked as a Roslindale barber for 67 years
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Bob Aliano, former owner of Rialto Barber Shop in Roslindale, died on February 14, 2026, at age 87.
Aliano worked as a barber for 67 years, making many friends and loyal customers at his shop since 1959.
Funeral services for Bob Aliano will be held on February 22-23 at George F. Doherty & Sons Funeral Home.

title: Red Sox infielder Caleb Durbin discussed how wrestling background helps with fielding
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Red Sox infielder Caleb Durbin utilizes his wrestling background for quicker defensive positioning on the field.
Durbin was acquired in a February trade and could play multiple infield positions for manager Alex Cora.
Originally from Illinois, Durbin excelled in wrestling and baseball, opting to pursue baseball at Washington University in St. Louis.

title: 5 best new restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston (Feb. 19, 2026)
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Boston Harbor Distillery to open a beer garden on the Rose Kennedy Greenway in Spring 2026.
Wulf's Fish and Savenor's Butchery collaborate to open Boston Provisions Market in the Seaport on March 2, 2026.
Monarca Taqueria opens a second location in Waltham, offering a customizable menu of burritos, bowls, and tacos.

title: A Wendyâ€™s near you may be closing soon
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Wendy's will close around 300 U.S. locations next year as part of a profitability improvement plan.
The closures, affecting 5% to 6% of its U.S. stores, are part of Wendy's 'Project Fresh' initiative.
Wendy's hired consultancy Creed UnCo to assist in brand revitalization aimed at enhancing store efficiency and guest experience.

title: 6 maps predicting snowfall totals Friday into Saturday
author: John Waller
bullets: Snowfall expected Friday into Saturday, with 3-6 inches north of Route 2, including Merrimack Valley.
Greater Boston to see 1-3 inches of snow due to temperature variations and sleet/freezing rain.
Meteorologists predict possible northward shift of snow bands based on updated data.

title: Where to find the best food under $20 in Waltham
author: Katelyn Umholtz and Abby Patkin
bullets: Waltham offers various budget-friendly dining options, including Taqueria El Amigo and Boston Kebab, with meals under $20.
Carl's Steak Subs in Waltham is renowned for its $16 cheesesteak special, praised for its generous portions and flavor.
Guanachapi's Mexican and Latin Food on Moody Street provides a filling lunch of pupusa and enchiladas for $14.20.

title: Turning 40 made her discover running. Ten years later, she’s running Boston.
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Melissa Rousselle, 50, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to celebrate turning 50 and address her own mental health journey.
Rousselle discovered running at 40, which became a vital outlet for managing depression and anxiety throughout the past decade.
She is raising funds for Rebekah's Angels Foundation, aiding children and families affected by trauma in receiving therapy.

title: For $3 million, a Newton ‘painted lady’ with plenty of whimsy
author: Megan Johnson
bullets: The historic Charles Davis House, a Second Empire style home, is located at 929 Beacon Street in Newton Center.
Originally built in 1860, the 7,313-square-foot house was transformed by an architect into a vibrant, modern residence.
The six-bedroom home with unique gardens, a library, and extra living wing is listed for $2,995,000.

title: Could Brian Thomas Jr. be a legitimate trade target for Patriots this offseason?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Brian Thomas Jr. recorded 1,282 yards and 10 touchdowns in his 2024 rookie season with the Jaguars.
Thomas' production dropped in 2025, with only 48 catches for 707 yards and two touchdowns.
Patriots could consider trading for Thomas to bolster their offense and support QB Drake Maye.
